title: Affordable luxury: our pick of the best upmarket cars to buy second-hand
text:
Well, perhaps not an economy budget in some cases but all of the cars here still represent an awful lot of luxury for the cash. Some need particularly careful buying to avoid big bills spoiling the relaxing ambience, but get it right and the feel-good factor will be unbeatable

BMW 7 Series E38 (1994–2001)

Launched in 1994, the third generation 7 Series boasted sleeker styling than its square-edged predecessor along with masses of tech. As well as being the first European car to feature satellite navigation buyers could impress the neighbours with the in-car television, while the spacious cabin was supremely comfortable. Straight-six engines make the most sense today and barely £1500 bags one of those models, but the stonking V12 is mighty tempting.
